intro: Henriettea membranifolia, commonly known as the membranous leaf heath, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its delicate white or pink flowers bloom in late spring, adding a subtle beauty to alpine landscapes. Henriettea membranifolia is often found in cloud forests and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its mountainous habitat.
